description:
The Government has published plans to reform Data Protection Laws in the UK. It’s worse than we thought. The Data Protection and Digital Information Bill, henceforth known as the ‘Data Discrimination Bill’ represents a major assault on rights recently gained under UK GDPR.
We are having a members and supporters briefing on Zoom (also streamed to our YouTube Account) from 7pm in the evening on Thursday 20th October. The briefing will talk you through some of the details of the bill, and our plans to campaign against it.
Speaker line up
Chaired by Jim Killock ORG CEO
Guest Speaker – [Carole Cadwalladr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carole_Cadwalladr) – is a British author, investigative journalist and features writer. Cadwalladr rose to international
prominence in 2018 for her role in exposing the [Facebook–Cambridge Analytica data scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook%E2%80%93Cambridge_Analytica_data_scandal).
[Mariano delli Santi ](https://www.openrightsgroup.org/who-we-are/mariano-delli-santi/)-ORG’s Policy Lead on the bill will provide us with his briefing on the bill.
[Sophia Akram](https://www.openrightsgroup.org/who-we-are/sophia-akram/) and [Sadhya Darr ](https://www.openrightsgroup.org/who-we-are/sahdya-darr/)– Will talk about our sector outreach work.
[Abigail Burke](https://www.openrightsgroup.org/who-we-are/abigail-burke/) – Our policy manager on data protection
[James Baker](https://www.openrightsgroup.org/who-we-are/james-baker/) – Will speak about the campaign action you can take on the bill.
title: Data Discrimination Bill Briefing with guest speaker Carole Cadwalladr
